Header: Russia beat Spain on penalties to reach World Cup quarters
Content: Hosts Russia beat Spain 4-3 on penalties to advance to the World Cup quarter-finals where they will face either Denmark or Croatia. Spain, who have never beaten a host at World Cups or Euros, went ahead after 12 minutes when Sergei Ignashevich bundled into Spain captain Sergio Ramos at the far post, knocking a free kick in with his heel for the 10th own goal of the tournament. At the end of extra time, Russia keeper Igor Akinfeev saved Koke’s and Iago Aspas’ spot kicks in their first ever penalty shootout.
